instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A stuck at Apple logo
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that gets stuck at Apple logo.

It has cpu activity, pulls 19.5V from  ampmeter, and I get voltages on big coils, but stays at Apple logo for one or two minutes, and them stays stuck at the progress bar loading...

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A stuck at Apple logo
threads.message:
Try DFU revive.
If no important data on internal SSD, try DFU restore directly.
